greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of Product_{m>=1} (1+q^m)^(-32).
comment: In general, for k > 0, if g.f. = Product_{m>=1} 1/(1+q^m)^k, then a(n) ~ (-1)^n * exp(Pi*sqrt(k*n/6)) * k^(1/4) / (2^(7/4) * 3^(1/4) * n^(3/4)). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 27 2015
link: Seiichi Manyama, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
mathematica: nmax = 50; CoefficientList[Series[Product[1/(1 + x^k)^32, {k, 1, nmax}], {x, 0, nmax}], x] (* _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Aug 27 2015 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
